revised_title: Observational Status of Black Holes in Astrophysics
tldr: This article discusses the observational status of black holes and their implications in astrophysics. It explores the detection of black holes in binary systems, globular clusters, galactic nuclei, and quasars. The article also touches upon the potential detection of gravitational waves, the role of black holes in intergalactic space, and the evaporation of mini black holes.
